detail.text: I would definitely recommend my course to others
detail.original: i would definitely recommend my course to others, it gave me a wide range of experiences, the 4th year project gives a real insight into the practice of academic research.

detail.text: the course are all obviously at the top of their area internationally so I could ask for no better.
detail.original: the university resources, teaching,, the course are all obviously at the top of their area internationally so i could ask for no better.

detail.text: good education
detail.original: good education, however, comes at a price.

detail.text: some classes are terrible
detail.original: some classes are terrible, with unprepared teachers who stumble on a single question, waste half of the class because of it.

detail.text: great education
detail.original: great education, fantastic fellow students.

detail.text: management is a brilliant course combining a cutting edge science
detail.original: materials, economics, management is a brilliant course combining a cutting edge science, engineering with business kills, economics which makes it a very desirable combination for employers, to do well in life

detail.text: the best part of the course is the fourth year where students have the chance to join an existing research group.
detail.original: the best part of the course is the fourth year where students have the chance to join an existing research group.

detail.text: so would only recommend it to someone who is exceptionally motivated
detail.original: however, i have struggled to cope with the lack of structure in the course, so would only recommend it to someone who is exceptionally motivated, already knows which areas of the syllabus in particular he or she wants to study.

detail.text: most of your lectures are with other people who know a lot more than you
detail.original: you get thrown in at the deep end, most of your lectures are with other people who know a lot more than you, for example you learn genetics with the biologists, biochemists.

detail.text: I wouldn't recommend doing it without some kind of scientific background cos I had to work quite hard to catch up.
detail.original: i hadn't done biology alevel, i wouldn't recommend doing it without some kind of scientific background cos i had to work quite hard to catch up.

detail.text: I would only recommend my university to prospective students based on some areas
detail.original: i would only recommend my university to prospective students based on some areas, not all.

detail.text: oxford is a brilliant city for students
detail.original: socially, oxford is a brilliant city for students, the nightlife is great, the city in general has so much to do all the time.

detail.text: then the great people alone would make it worth it.
detail.original: if it wasn't for the fact that it happens to be one of the most beautiful cities, there is always somewhere to go or something to do whether it be a pub, society meeting or a room party, and, if you're studying the right subject, constant intellectual stimulation, then the great people alone would make it worth it.

detail.text: fantastic fellow students.
detail.original: great education, fantastic fellow students.

detail.text: nice people
detail.original: nice people, good courses,, a great city.

detail.text: obviously because you study so many different things you don't go into as much depth so some people worry it's a bit of a 'jack of all trade
detail.original: obviously because you study so many different things you don't go into as much depth so some people worry it's a bit of a 'jack of all trade, master of none' approach.

detail.text: the people are lovely
detail.original: the people are lovely,, not at all snobby as people seem to assume after a hard first, second term i really did have a wonderful third term.

detail.text: you meet amazing people while you're here.
